# isUserInteractionEnabled

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that determines whether user events are ignored and removed from the event queue.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var isUserInteractionEnabled: Bool { get set }
```

## Discussion

When set to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false], touch, press, keyboard, and focus events intended for the view are ignored and removed from the event queue. When set to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], events are delivered to the view normally. The default value of this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true].

During an animation, user interactions are temporarily disabled for all views involved in the animation, regardless of the value in this property. You can disable this behavior by specifying the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIView/AnimationOptions/allowUserInteraction] option when configuring the animation.



## Configuring the event-related behavior

- **isMultipleTouchEnabled**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the view receives more than one touch at a time.
- **isExclusiveTouch**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the receiver handles touch events exclusively.
